results.title: Cliff hangers [B&W]
results.brief_description: Over a gleaming ice field and up steep cliffs of bare rock, the camera follows members of the Alpine Club of Canada. Before they set out we are introduced to the climbers’ basic equipment and learn the uses of rope and ice axe. Excitement mounts with the Alpinists as they leap gaping chasms and drag themselves up a sheer wall of rock. At the top, they pause for a view of the sea of mountains lying around their own vanquished peak. Narrated by Lorne Greene.

results.title: Clickers club: photo adventures in curriculum
results.creator_credit: Corporate Development, Western Region and TV ED Productions, Tony Paice and Jeff Spencer
results.brief_description: Outlines the aims of a new photography club established throughout Victorian schools. Marg Sheehan interviews Leigh Hepburn who introduces the Project Kit, Roxanne Rodgers who explains its uses in an integrated curriculum and Gail Evans who applies the resources during a primary school class excursion to the zoo.

results.title: Click go the shears
results.creator_credit: Link Films, Keith Gow and Jerome Levy
results.brief_description: A highly stylised humorous treatment of the famous Australian ballad, using a minimum of animation. Sung by Cedric McLaughlin and the Link Singers.

results.title: Clever Hiko Ichi
results.brief_description: Provides a backdrop for language arts activities such as storytelling, creative dramatics, and reading, by presenting an animated story about a little boy in medieval Japan who solves three difficult problems with a bit of applied science and personal fortitude.

results.title: Clerks
results.creator_credit: View Askew Productions, Scott Mosier and Kevin Smith
results.brief_description: The first in a planned ‘Jersey Trilogy’ (which now includes ‘Mall Rats’ and ‘Chasing Amy’), Kevin Smith’s low budget feature debut captures with loads of humour and pop culture references, the malaises of 20 somethings struggling with relationships and working in dead end jobs they are way over qualified to be in. Twenty two year old Dante Hicks (Brian O’Halloran) works at the local Quick stop convenience store in New Jersey, a job he resents and finds almost unbearable if it wasn’t for his best friend Randal (Jeff Anderson), working at the video shop next door. ‘Clerks’ covers one eventful day of their lives as they ponder the unfair work practices of the evil empire in the Star Wars trilogy, find out what ‘snowballing’ is, insult customers, and grapple with their own uncertain future. All the while turning the work ethos on its head. Meanwhile, outside the store local drug dealers Silent Bob (Kevin Smith) and his sidekick Jay (Jason Mewes) give their own skewed philosophy on life. Cast also includes Marilyn Ghigliotti, Lisa Spoonhauer and Scott Mosier. (Awards: 1994 Sundance Film Festival Filmmakers Trophy and 1994 Cannes Young Cinema Award)

results.title: Clerambard
results.brief_description:
Clerambard lives on the edge of poverty in an old castle. He ekes a living out of killing cats and dogs and exploiting his family. His life is turned updside down after reading ‘The life of St Fancis of Assissi’. The Saint even appears to help Clerambard go out into the world to preach the gospel and reveal his newfound love of animals.

Credits: Producers, Yves Robert, Alain Poire ; director, Yves Robert ; writers, Jean-Loup Dabadie, Yves Robert ; photography, Rene Mathelin ; music, Vladimir Cosma.
Cast: Philippe Noiret, Dany Carrel, Lise Delamare, Gerard Lartigau, Claude Pieplu, Roger Carel, Martine Sarcey.

results.title: Cleopatra Jones and the casino of gold
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, William Tennant and Chuck Bail
results.brief_description: Tamara Dobson reprises her role as special agent Cleopatra Jones, a martial arts crime buster, who’s fierce Kung Fu moves are only eclipsed by her outlandish dress sense and heavy eye make up (Dobson is credited as her own make up artist). In her latest adventure Cleopatra finds herself in Hong Kong, taking on the vast drug cartel which is run by the evil and aptly named Dragon Lady (Stella Stevens). Highlights from this blaxploitation action film include Cleopatra’s poor attempts at undercover work, a difficult task for a 6‘2 black woman in Hong Kong, made even more impossible by her outrageous choice of wardrobe and unbelievable head gear. Cast also includes Tanny, Norman Fell, Albert Popwell and Caro Kenyatta.

results.title: Cleopatra Jones
results.creator_credit: William Tennant, Bill Tennant and Jack Starett
results.brief_description: Cleopatra Jones is dedicated to wiping out drug dealers on an international scale, with her personal anger directed at the pushers who operate in the ghettos. One such operator is her arch-nemesis, the black leathered ‘Mommy’. When the drug traffickers’s deadliest and most beautiful enemy oversees the torching of a poppy field in Turkey, she leaves Mommy feeling pretty burned up. Mommy’s revenge is first directed at the ghetto’s anti-drug headquarter and Cleo must take on Mommy and her offbeat stooges Doodlebug, Pickle, Snake and more. Cast includes Tamara Dobson, Bernie Casey, Brenda Sykes, Antonio Fargas, Bill McKinner and Shelley Winters.

results.title: Cleopatra [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Walter Wanger and Joseph L Mankiewicz
results.brief_description: Elizabeth Taylor, Richard Burton and Rex Harrison star in this tale of power and betrayal - the legendary story of the Queen of the Nile and her conquest of Julius Caesar and Marc Antony. An unforgettable portrayal of the beguiling beauty who seduced two of Rome’s greatest soldiers and changed the course of history. Also stars: Pamela Brown, George Cole, Hume Cronyn, Cesare Danova, Kenneth Haigh, Andrew Keir, Martin Landau, Roddy McDowall, Robert Stephens and Francesca Annis. Music by Alex North. Screenplay by Joseph L. Mankiewicz, Ranald MacDougall and Sidney Buchman. Cinematography by Leon Shamroy. (Academy Awards: Cinematography, Art direction, Costumes, Sets and Special effects)
